editorialNotes.standard: Put a little â€œbooâ€ in your botany by concocting herbal remedies for odd supernatural ailments in this eerie puzzle-adventure.

Mesmerising from start to finish, Monument Valley offers a world of uncanny beauty and constant wonder. To help a princess proceed on her mysterious quest, youâ€™ll face ingenious puzzles that involve lifting and spinning the environment in seemingly impossible ways. Itâ€™s a mind-bending journey filled with the joy of discovery, making Ustwoâ€™s adventure a must-play for gamers of every experience level.

editorialNotes.standard: This absorbing puzzler is so minimalist thereâ€™s no start screen, no logos, no instructionsâ€”it just begins. We quickly got lost in the challenge of rearranging tiles, Rubikâ€™s Cubeâ€“style, so a single line runs through each pattern. Our advice: sort out the corners and other unique tiles first, then the rest will snap quickly into place.

editorialNotes.standard: Come for the satisfaction of solving mysteries; stay for this unforgettable adventureâ€™s lovable characters and excellent writing.

If you can doodle, you can play this one-of-a-kind Apple Design Award winner. Just draw a lineâ€”any lineâ€”and watch it spring to life across the screen, following your gestures to collect coloured dots and avoid black holes. But as the holes form increasingly elaborate obstacles, only the most ingenious doodles will do. With endless solutions to every challenge, itâ€™s a stylish, supremely satisfying test of your creativity and puzzle-solving prowess.

editorialNotes.short: Brilliant puzzle designs and a haunting atmosphere make this unforgettable
editorialNotes.standard: Now hereâ€™s how you build a sequel! With The Room Three, Fireproof Games kept everything we love about this seriesâ€”its chilling atmosphere, mind-bending puzzles and beautiful visualsâ€”while making masterful enhancements. The story continues with trials set by a creepy new nemesis, The Craftsman. As you explore huge areas and tiny ones, the challenges feel increasingly epic, and a better-than-ever hint system ensures that finding solutions is super-rewarding.

editorialNotes.standard: Limbo is a gripping blend of stark, haunting landscapes, bizarre characters and unsettling sounds. With clever puzzle design, an intriguing narrative and an excellent touch-screen control system, itâ€™s as rewarding to play as it is interesting to look at and listen to.
editorialNotes.short: Dark, haunting, beautiful. This'll stay with you long after it's over.

editorialNotes.standard: After a long day at work, itâ€™s bath time! But Swampyâ€™s shower is broken and he needs your help to guide the water to him. Navigate a path through the dirt past contraptions and obstacles to get every drop to fill the bath.Â

name: Tick Tock: A Tale for Two

editorialNotes.standard: A fascinating reinvention of a longtime videogame franchise, Hitman GO takes familiar elements of stealth and assassination and reinterprets them as a wondrously stylised, turn-based boardgame. Each mission presents characters and scenesâ€”some from previous Hitman gamesâ€”as a sleek diorama, blending old and new to create an innovative experience. Even with helpful distractions and places to hide, inching toward your targets a step at a time demands keen strategy, and trying to pull off optional mission objectives quickly becomes an irresistible obsession.

editorialNotes.short: Unravel family secrets on a remote island cursed by plagues in this dark puzzle adventure.

editorialNotes.standard: You might get stuck the first time you play Gorogoa. But once the gears of your brain settle into the right configurations, youâ€™ll see how smart this mix of art and perspective really is. Layers pile upon layers, doors transport you between realities, strange creatures and wild environments blend together into a fascinating interactive collage youâ€™ll want to peel apart to discover what lies underneath.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: When dinosaurs collide with LEGO bricks, you donâ€™t have to be Mr. DNA to know the result is pure fun. Starring characters and creatures from all four Jurassic Park movies, this fantastic adventure lets you relive your favorite moments from the series and even create new ones with your own custom dinos. Full of all the humor, action, and surprises you expect, itâ€™s a wacky team-up of T-Rex proportions.

Being able to write computer code is a supremely useful talent, but learning the basics can be a tough, tedious slog. Human Resource Machine wraps computer logic fundamentals inside a wonderful, whimsical puzzle game, full of cartoon conveyer belts and demanding managers. Itâ€™s so much fun you might not realise how much knowledge youâ€™re soaking up.
With relaxed swapping rules and charming graphics, this surprisingly slick match-3 puzzler makes the genre feel fresh again.

editorialNotes.standard: Weâ€™ll take any excuse to visit Deus Exâ€™s techno dystopia, but experiencing it as a turn-based puzzler is a true delight. What amazes us most is how Deus Ex GO re-creates the action-RPG seriesâ€™ trademark features while preserving the stunning visuals and clever strategy of Lara Croft GO and Hitman GO. We got chills stomping guards with vicious takedowns and altering levels by hacking them. Thereâ€™s even an intriguing story (pitting Adam Jensen against heavily armed terrorists) to keep you going.

editorialNotes.short: Beautiful, challenging, and always inventive - these brilliant puzzles will really test you.

editorialNotes.standard: FEZ begins with a simple idea: you can rotate the world. The more you play, the more you understand this conceptâ€™s far-reaching implications as you jump between ledges and rotate perspective to get pieces of the world to align. The complexity and sophistication of the puzzles keeps growing, building on ideas and forcing you to think in new ways. FEZ is perfect for anyone who loves scouring every little corner of virtual spaces for hidden secrets.
